{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question asks what characterizes tuberculous otitis media except. We need to identify the characteristics of tuberculous otitis media from the given documents. The documents describe common clinical findings as insidious onset of painless watery drainage, severe hearing loss, multiple perforations of the tympanic membrane and subsequent appearance of profuse granulation tissue. They also mention facial paralysis, cochlear involvement with labyrinthitis and further hearing loss, and finally intracranial dissemination of infection may occur. None of these characteristics include C: Pain, as tuberculous otitis media is described as having an insidious onset without pain.", "answer_choice": "C"}
